data.desc: FlashX provides a Go package that helps easily setup a reverse proxy for your server/s. It supports the following features: - Reverse Proxy - Reverse Proxy based on custom logic - Load Balancing - Round Robin - Weighted Round Robin - Least Connections - Blacklist IPs - Rate Limiting (requests per second) - Modify Request and Response - Buffer Pool - Custom Error Handler - Custom Logger - Flush Interval Take a look at some examples on how to use this package.
data.stack: Created using **Go**, providing a package that can be imported in your applications to utilize the feature filled reverse proxy server

data.desc: A UI design for a messenger application designed in Flutter
An online shopping store on your fingertips. Choose from a variety of clothing, add them to your cart, pay for it and get it delivered.
data.stack:
Created using **React**, with **Redux** for state management, **Redux Persist** to persist data on refresh, **Redux Logger** to analyze redux operations while development, and **Reselect** as a state selector library.

Authentication is powered by **Firebase**, and payments are operating using **Stripe**.

data.desc:
Your one stop solution to manage your vehicle. Simply add your vehicle and some nitty gritty details about it. After your driving sessions, add your odometer readings, and we'll calculate the necessary things for you.

Nearing maintenance? track your vehicle in the dashboard and schedule your maintenance with the retailer.


Poor performance of your vehicle over a period of time? We'll alert you and your retailer about the same.
data.stack:
The web interface is written in **HTML** and **embedded Javascript** while leveraging the power of **Bootstrap**. The backend is powered by **Node**, with **Firebase** being used as the datastore.

**NodeMailer** is used to trigger emails, while **fusioncharts**, **plotly** and **nodeplotlib** are being utilized to generate the beautiful and informative graphs.

data.desc: The latest and the greatest tech news from Hackernews and Reddit, two of the most popular platforms for trending news about technology.
data.stack: Created using **React**, with a **Go** based API backend. Also hosts a CLI application that prints out articles from Hackernews and Reddit for the console lovers written in **Go**.
